intro: Lacistema ellipticum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf lacistema, is a herbaceous perennial native to the southern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
